Title: Crippling Safetyism
Text: Until this Ticket is closed, no other TECH Ticket can be worked on.
Notes: One of the main concerns: whether to use Markets for referencing them like this.

Title: Pre-Release
Text: You can only place counters on this Ticket when there 2 or fewer non-Completed Features in the Product.

Title: We Need A 10x Engineer!
Text: Only the CTO can place counters on this Ticket.

Title: API Integrations
Text: üöÄ: Place 1 counter on this Ticket for every 5 TECH Tickets in the Work discard pile.
Notes: Probably should be in reverse? If 3 or fewer, then API integration is fast?

Title: Hard To Grasp
Text: üÖ∞Ô∏è: Roll a die. If even, place that many counters on this Ticket. If odd, remove that many.

Title: Picky Customers
Text:
üöÄ: Roll a die. Place that many counters on this Ticket.

üÖ∞Ô∏è:  Spend your action to remove 1 counter. At 0, close it.

Title: Microservice Architecture
Text: üöÄ: For each standalone group of Completed single-Market Features, place 1 counter on this Ticket. If 6 counters or more, close this Ticket.
Notes: Need to reformulate the "standalone group" term, or use that mechanic more often so that it's in the glossary.

Title: A Dozen Sigma Mockups
Text: üöÄ: Place 1 counter on this Ticket for each Completed Feature that has matching Markets with the Feature under this Ticket.

Title: Slopification
Text:
üöÄ: Place 1 counter on this Ticket for every Open DESIGN or MARKETING Ticket (this one included; up to 10 counters).

üÖ∞Ô∏è:  Spend your action to remove 1 counter. At 0, close it.

Title: You'll Need A Vacation
Text: üÖ∞Ô∏è:  Spend your action and discard 3 cards from your hand to close this Ticket at once.

Title: Wildcard
Text: This Ticket acts as if it belongs to each category.

Title: Cracked (???)
Text: üÖ∞Ô∏è: Roll a die. On 5-6, place as many counters on this Ticket as there are on the cheapest adjacent Ticket (on 4 sides). If 5 counters or more, close this Ticket.

Title: Fix The Typo
Text: üéØ: If there is another Ticket under this one and it's a TECH Ticket, roll a die. On 6, close that other TECH Ticket as well.

Title: AI Isn't A Pit, AI Is A Mirror
Text: When placing counters on this Ticket, place instead as many counters as there are cards in the hand of the player who has the least cards.
Notes: Originally, the name was "AI Isn't A Mind, It's A Mirror"

Title: Bad On Purpose
Text:
üéØ: The player who closed this Ticket either:
- draws a card if this is the last Ticket before the Feature is Completed
- discards a card otherwise

Title: Generate The Logo
Text: You cannot conventionally place counters on this Ticket. Instead, spend your action and roll a die. On 6, close this Ticket.

Title: Merging Databases
Text: üöÄ: Place 4 counters on this Ticket. For each currently open TECH Ticket in the Product, remove 1 counter.

Title: Crasher
Text: Discard a card every time you place counters on this Ticket.

Title: Reprioritization
Text:
Pull one counter from every adjacent (on 4 sides) Ticket, if possible.

Spend your action to remove a counter from this Ticket. At 0, close it.

Title: Prompt Engineering
Text: You cannot conventionally place a counter on this Ticket. Instead, spend your action and roll a die. On 5-6, place 1 counter on it.
